body: Both issues indicate there is some processing that works on `![]()` images, but not on the `` variant, so it's not a direct regression from that PR because `` is supported since a long time, it just was never noticed.

Can confirm above suspicion, there is [transformImage](https://github.com/go-gitea/gitea/blob/aace3bccc3290446637cac30b121b94b5d03075f/modules/markup/markdown/transform_image.go#L15) which apparently is never applied on user-supplied `` tags because maybe Goldmark does not emit it as `ast.Image` or something.

Yeah so this is no easy fix in backend because `` tags do not go through goldmark AST processing I think, they likely go through as raw html so need to introduce the wrapper link here: https://github.com/go-gitea/gitea/blob/aace3bccc3290446637cac30b121b94b5d03075f/modules/markup/html.go#L399

Actually it is a regression. No matter how markdown / img work, as an end users: 1. I would like to click an image to show the full size (especially when it is a full-size screenshot) 2. I would like to deploy Gitea under a sub-path and paste images into the editor I do not care about `` or something else, but now: 1. I can't 2. I can't ---- As a developer, I think there is an undefined / unclear behavior for the embedded `` tag when it has a relative `src` link. But I do not think it's worth to make it more complex than it should be at the moment.

issue.body:
### Description

Regression after update from `1.21.5` to `1.22.0`.
When uploading images via copy paste as a screenshot, the feature is now broken, depending on Browser, see Screenshots below. 

On Firefox, when Pasting images, the behavior is the same as `1.21.5`: Image gets pasted as Markdown and is visible. No broken links.

But on Microsoft Edge, the Links become HTML, not markdown and have broken links, as they they have the slash prefix, which are broken in a subpath context.
(Note: The file upload itself completes, you can fix this by changing it manually to Markdown)


Context: This is a Gitea instance on a subpath (domain.com/git)
```
[server]
SSH_DOMAIN = domain.net/git
DOMAIN = domain.net/git
HTTP_PORT = 3000
ROOT_URL = https://domain.net/git/
```

There have been multiple issues with subpaths around Gitea from time to time with broken file links appearing in different places, most recent: https://github.com/go-gitea/gitea/issues/31546

### Gitea Version

1.22.0

### Can you reproduce the bug on the Gitea demo site?

No
